443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:54): and insert it

e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:55): I want that xmlelement be done in function
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:55): not in query

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:55): you don't need any functions or anything
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:55): if you want to take a table you use xmlforest()

e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:56): offer and spo
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:56): select your columns in an inner query.. xml transform it using xmlelement() etc in an other
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:56): I make xml from offer,spo in many queries
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:56): but logic of making XML (attributes) is same
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:56): I want to extract the logic of making xml line
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:57): it seems natural to pass every line to function
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:57): that forms xmlemenet
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:57): ok, anyway you probably need to derive all columns
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:58): not sure how to do it right way
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:58): and feed the individual columns to xmlelement() functions or to xmltree()
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:58): offer2xml is meant to make xmlement from 2 lines
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:58): one from offer, one from spo
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:58): yes but you can't parse the rowtypes to the functions
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:58): you need individual columns

e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (23:59): this declaration

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (23:59): and doubt your input here works
